ud4.9:1.2: At one time the Buddha was staying near Rājagaha, in the Bamboo Grove, the squirrels’ feeding ground.
ud4.9:1.3: Then as Venerable Upasena son of Vaṅgantā was in private retreat this thought came to his mind:
ud4.9:1.5: My Teacher is the Blessed One, perfected, a fully awakened Buddha.
ud4.9:1.6: Well explained is the teaching and training in which I have gone forth from the lay life to homelessness.
ud4.9:1.7: My spiritual companions are ethical and of good character.
ud4.9:1.9: My mind is unified and serene.
ud4.9:1.10: I am a perfected one who has ended the defilements.
ud4.9:1.11: I am of great might and power.
ud4.9:1.12: My life has been good, and my death will be good.”
ud4.9:2.1: Then, knowing what that Venerable Upasena was thinking, on that occasion the Buddha expressed this heartfelt sentiment:
ud4.9:3.1: “One who has no guilt in life,
ud4.9:3.3: that wise one who has seen the truth,
ud4.9:4.1: For the mendicant with peaceful mind,
ud4.9:4.2: who has cut off craving for continued existence,
ud4.9:4.4: there are no future lives for them.”
